channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped clothes, 25th January
item.description:
Ceres Road and Kashgar Road needs a solution to stop the flytipping. Lots of clothes scattered around and school children will be walking through these streets tomorrow. Any chance we can have cameras to stop this please. There is not a single day we have clean streets.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kashgar Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shop front covers are blocking pavement, 25th January
item.description:
The shop has plastic covers which are covering their fruit and veg however they have tied a loose end of the cover to a sign post pole therefore blocking half the pavement making it extremely difficult for wheelchair users and pram users
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ballards Lane, Church End, Greater London

item.title: Extensive grafitti, 25th January
item.description:
Regular groups of teenagers use this spot as a meeting place. My perimeter fence and garage have been covered with grafitti. We have reported regular drug dealing from the end of Ernest Close all the way up to my garage. CCTV would certainly discourage them from gathering here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ernest Close, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish spilling from bins: probably foxes, 25th January
item.description:
The two bins west of Honor Oak Park station have been raided by foxes. The rubbish is spread over the pavement and gutter. I believe this to be SOUTHWARK council’s responsibility, not Lewisham as FixMyStreet seems to think. I have to say I walk past here every day and it is generally tidy. Maybe there is no collection at the weekend??

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honor Oak Park, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sign needs cleaning, 25th January
item.description:
The street sign for Kings Hall Road opposite the junction with Reddons Road is barely legible as it's totally covered in dirt. Needs a good clean.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic cone left after pavement repairs, 25th January
item.description:
Orange cone left by council contractors after pavement repair in December. I've reported this in the pavement/road category but it was closed without being fixed. Trip hazard, especially for those with mobility issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Lane, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 previously filled potholes in Cranbrook Road before turning into Longmore Ave which urgently need repair, 25th January
item.description:
These 2 potholes are just before turning left from Cranbrook Road into Longmore Avenue. They are in the left hand lane and were previously filled about a year ago, but with recent cold weather they have reappeared and the previous filling has disintegrated! These urgently need repair as they are deep potholes and likely to cause damage/injury. Unable to stop safely and take photos but why when they were only filled a year ago have they already disintegrated after one bout of cold weather? Are there no guarantees on the work of contractors when they fill potholes? If there were then they might do a better and long lasting job! More beneficial for local council tax payers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Cranbrook Road, East Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 25th January
item.description:
The drain has been blocked for years, leading to a large pools of water whenever it rains. This makes it difficult to cross the road especially for the disabled. It's been reported many times and was even supposed to have been resolved once, but is still the same.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 697, High Road, North Finchley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
